intro: Pseudognaphalium petitianum, commonly known as the narrowleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant is known for its long-lasting flowers, which are used in floral arrangements and traditional medicine.
